Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" .
Trump says administration looking at sending criminals out of country
“Numerous countries” have offered to imprison U.S. citizen criminals, President Donald Trump said Tuesday, and “if we have the legal right to do it, I would do it in a heartbeat.”
For “a small fee compared to what we pay” in government-run and private prisons in this country, he said, “we can make deals where we get these animals out of our country.”
He said his administration was examining the legality of such action.
Trump’s comments, made in response to questions from reporters witnessing his signing of new executive orders at the White House, came after Salvadoran President Nayib Bukele said this week that he would imprison U.S. criminals for payment.
“We have hardened criminals, horrible people, you see them pushing people into subways,” Trump said. “We don’t want these people in our country. … These people are never going to be any good.”
If they are sent out of the country, he said, “you would have a lot less crime automatically.”
